hint.text: Take note that the sphere is hollow.

solution.text:
Density of material, \(\rho=_{j}_\,\frac{kg}{m^3}\)
Inner diameter, \(d_1=_{k}_\,m\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Inner radius, \(r_1=_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_\,m\)
Thickness, \(t=_{l}_\,cm\)
Outer radius, \(r_2=r_1+t=_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_+_{{trunc((l*Decimal(0.01)),2)}}_=_{{trunc((k/Decimal(2)+l*Decimal(0.01)),2)}}_\,m\)
Volume of the object, \(V=\frac43 \pi (r_2^3-r_1^3)\)
\(=\frac43 \pi (_{{trunc((k/Decimal(2)+l*Decimal(0.01)),2)}}_^3-_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_^3)\)
\(=\frac43 \pi (_{{trunc(((k/Decimal(2)+l*Decimal(0.01))**3),3)}}_-_{{(k/Decimal(2))**3}}_)\)
\(\Rightarrow V=_{{trunc(((Decimal(4)/3)*pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2)+l*Decimal(0.01))**3)-((k/Decimal(2))**3))),3)}}_\,m^3\)
Mass of the object, \(M=V \times \rho\)
\(\Rightarrow M=_{{trunc(((Decimal(4)/3)*pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2)+l*Decimal(0.01))**3)-((k/Decimal(2))**3))),3)}}_ \times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow M=_{{trunc(((Decimal(4)/3)*pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2)+l*Decimal(0.01))**3)-((k/Decimal(2))**3))*j),3)}}_\,kg\)

content.text: The mass of a spherical object of material density \(_{j}_\,\frac{kg}{m^3}\) with inner diameter \(_{k}_\,m\) and  \(_{l}_\,cm\) thickness.
